inn1.comm: over the wicket, steams in and places the ball on a length, shaping back and blocked in front of the stumps
tight lines from Steyn - it's like he never went away - and Warner has to be watchful in defence again
pitched up, a fraction wide and Warner bullies it through the covers, gets forward and cuffs three between two men out towards the boundary rope
done him, 134kph and swinging the outside edge! Not a very edifying shot from Finch, trying to belabour his first ball over cover and failing to connect
slightly straighter, lovely shape from Steyn, punched on the up to mid-off
snaking in with the arm, good length, 140kph and blocked diligently into the off side - solid start from SA's senior paceman
starts with a bit of a loosener, 125 clicks and wide of the off stump, Warner lashes out and carves himself four wide of third man
again some width, Warner latches on, such power in those hands as he rattles a cut through point, blink and you miss it
drags his length back, fended away off the hips for a single
pitched up in the channel outside off, Finch leans into a mistimed drive
slightly back of a length outside off, 139kph and rising through to the keeper as Finch leaves alone
fires a bumper down the leg side - easy money
back of a length, good pace and bounce, Finch turns to the leg side
Steyn settling into a groove, bringing the ball back on off, Warner covers up
a touch fuller, 141kph around the line of off, Warner pushes back down the ground, mid-off comes across
short, slightly leg side, jumps a bit and deflects behind square off the padding
back of a length, this seems to nip in a fraction, Finch wears it on the thigh pad
driven, in the air, did Steyn get a hand on that? Yes, looks like he did, just grazed the fingertips, though hard to call it a drop... Thumped back down the ground for Finch's first runs
length ball on off, Finch pumps it in the air again, short of mid-off this time
back of a length, on the pads but it beats Warner for pace
drops short and wide and again Warner chases it, slashed hard on the up over backward point and away
pitched up and driven into the covers, dropped by the fielder, the crowd groans... but it was a bump ball
full-bunger, nearly manages to slip it under the toe of the bat, Warner drops his meat cleaver in time
bangs in the short ball this time, climbs too high
fuller, outside off, Warner makes room and pings a drive towards mid-off, Phehlukwayo nearly does himself by going too far to his right but grabs it at the last moment
wheels from Rabada, back of a length at 149kph, Warner rides it and drops one into the covers
dug in, on the hips... and Warner scoops it high over fine leg for the first six of the innings! Used the pace well, quicksilver hands and Steyn was dumped well beyond the fence
pitched up and punched into the covers for one
slightly back of a length, angling in with the arm, nudged to the leg side
Finch shuffles across and taps the ball away to leg again
ripper of a ball, though another unwise shot selection from Finch, trying to drive off the back foot, a 141kph delivery sharks past the outside edge
too straight this time and Finch helps himself, length on the pads and clipped with alacrity through backward square leg
comes forward and pushes a length ball into the off side, mid-off gets to it and underarms into the non-striker's stumps... with the ricochet gifting Australia a second run
shortish, 136kph outside off, slapped straight to the fielder
beats the outside edge, extra bounce this time and Warner was feeling for it. Rabada stops momentarily to scrutinise the batsman in his crease
touch full, Warner is on the drive... and he picks up four more, a poor bit of fielding in the covers gifting a seventh boundary of the innings
angled across, chopped down into the off side
pitched up on off, Warner gets forward and dinks a single fine of mid-off to keep the strike
good length around off stump, giving nothing away, Warner defends
pushed across and straightening on off, 141kph and again respectfully defended from the crease
shorter length, goes back and drops down behind square on the off side
tally ho! Slightly too full from Steyn, no swing this time and Warner clubs through the line, a golf swing down the ground for four more!
drags his length back a touch, 142kph and shaping on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
good length in the channel, Warner presses out to block - intriguing contest, this
fullish, curving in, flicks off the pad as Finch works across the line
give it some licks! Warner hops back and takes a 151kph ball on the body, wind briefly knocked from his sails. The Gazelle of Doom walks back to his mark with a quiet smile on his face
back of a length, down the leg side, swing and a miss
touch short and straight again, nudged through backward square for one
dug in short, 136kph over middle and leg, Finch not interested in pulling
bangs in another short ball, quicker and rising like steam from a kettle over Finch's shoulder, that's one for the over
slips one in full and straight, maybe sliding to leg, deflects off the pads behind square as Rabada's appeal dies in his throat - that's the Australia 50, brought up at a good rate
back of a length, tapped down square on the off side
pitched up and slapped over the covers, doesn't quite get hold of it and the ball is hauled in front of the rope
on the body, Finch nudges another single to leg
short of a length, pushed across outside off, Warner glides one to third man
Steyn goes a touch too straight again, Finch flicks off his pads at the top of the bounce, some good fielding keeps them to one
better line and length, 145kph on middle and off, blocked
well, hello, that's a welcome! Slightly full outside off to begin with and Finch pops on his range-finder, launches six over wide long-off! G'day, mate
goes short in response and Finch muscles a pull to deep backward square, just one with the man out there

chipped to mid-off, Parnell strikes! Maybe stopped in the pitch a fraction... Certainly Warner was not on top of a regulation check drive, looped off the face of the bat and Phehlukwayo held on running to his right. All going off in Parnell's opening over
slightly back of a length on the stumps, defended from the crease walking across
fuller, outside off, driven into the ground and fielded in the covers
shorter and straighter again, 136kph and tapped down towards square leg
pops the ball slightly back of a length on off, 132kph and worked softly to the leg side
Finch goes back and across and defends back to the bowler
slightly short again and worked off the hips for a couple to fine leg
that's why he doesn't want to pitch it up... in the slot outside off and Finch clears the ropes for the second over in succession, drilling a handsome six back over the bowler's head
goes for the slower ball, slightly short and this sits up to be roundhoused through midwicket for another boundary
bit of width outside off and Finch slams four more through backward point! Two dots morph into 16 runs conceded in Phehlukwayo's opening over, a brutal back-foot mow skimming past the diving fielder
whipped of the pads, that's timed like a Rolex by Smith, just a step into line and he gets it in front of deep square leg for his first runs
jumps across to defend down into the off side
touch short, Smith tries to flick to leg and this time is hit on the thigh pad
SA leaking runs like a colander right now, too full in the channel and Smith showcases his cover drive this time, pinged in front of the off-side sweeper
tighter to the stumps, Smith pushes back towards the bowler
digs in the bouncer, Smith ducks nonchalantly underneath

short ball, flicked off the body in the air, Parnell throws himself forward at short fine leg... but did it carry? The SA fielders think so but Finch stands his ground and the third umpire will have to make a call on this. It was a tumbling effort on the edge of the ring, looks on first glance that he managed to get his fingers under the ball; but, with the number of replays being looked at by Nigel Llong, we're into the realms of foreshortening. But no, it's given! Think that's the right call, in real time Parnell appeared to have scooped it up from above the turf. Phehlukwayo - surely time we nicknamed him "Lucky" - gets his wicket
shuffles across to defend on off, they pinch a single
dug in and flying through above head height, Smith barely glances at it
good length around the line of off, blocked on the front foot

fuller, straighter, rattling into the pads... up goes the finger! Smith seemed to simply misjudge the length, caught on the crease trying to glance to leg, but he reviews the decision, hoping for a reprieve. No chance, that's hitting middle and leg, Smith is out! Two in the over for "Lucky"!
goes back and across and dabs the ball down square
slower ball, swatted down through midwicket for one
full on the pads and swiped for six! That's a sweet connection, just a pick-up flick but it sails into the boundary boards, Marsh sixing things up already
better line, driven into the ground, Rabada sticks out a paw to stop it
full toss and treated as such, a Marsh blast back past the bowler, beats mid-off and races away - that's the Australian ton up
good length outside off, lets this one go
dug in short at 140kph and smashed on the pull through midwicket! That is the shot of a man who is seeing it well, just his sixth delivery
line and and length outside off, happy to let this through and finish an expensive over with a dot
lovely shape on this one, moving away late from a fullish length, drawing Bailey forward like a magnet before beating the bat
shortish and defended from the crease on off
back of a length, Bailey hacks at a pull and gets one away through midwicket
good, tight line on off stump, Marsh pushes it away
short ball, swivels on the pull, clubbed hard behind square and although it's in the air it skips away to the fence
length ball, 132kph and prodded back watchfully into the off side
smoked through the covers, have some of that. Overpitched a touch, and wallop
nudged behind square, prompting Parnell to come round the wicket ...
worked off the hip for another single
pushed onto the back foot, stout defence
a bit of width and chopped through point
round the wicket, speared into the pads, tucked behind square
pushed into the covers
standing tall on the back foot, defended
outside off, slightly over-pitched but not quite timed into the covers
tight line, blocked back down the pitch
defended off the back foot once more
angled in and defended into the leg-side
thumped through midwicket, the bat turned on impact, but half a bat was plenty to spank that one to the rope
better line
solid defence on the front foot
well bowled again, a fraction back of a length, and a very tight line across the right-hander. Forcing Australia to hit on the up if they dare
opens the face this time in an attempted glide through third man, but point tidies up
outside off, drilled on the up into the covers
outside off, driven into the covers
pushed back into the crease, and fenced down to third man with a loose poke of the blade
banged in short, hops over the batsman's shoulder, and he gets away without a wide being called. Well bowled
that's a tremendous wallop through midwicket, rocking back and summing up the length with a dismissive waft of the bat. Shades of Punter in that expert length-picking
crunched down the ground, so straight that it splats the non-striker's stumps. That would have been four all the way
another whistling bouncer, but he's bowled his one for the over, so this one is called. Unlucky, as that was a good sharp delivery

edged, and stunningly caught by a one-handed de Kock behind the stumps! The extra delivery pays dividends, as Marsh hangs back in the crease, is drawn into a loose poke by the extra bounce, and the keeper snaffles it almost in slow motion, high to his right! Lucky strikes again! Trebles all round!
keeps a touch low and worked to the leg side with a shuffle across the crease
wafted off the back foot, out to deep point
wafted out through midwicket, a lovely flowing strike, using the angle into the pads and putting it away with aplomb
wider line outside off, Head leaves alone
a bit of swing from a full length, Head shoulders arms
a whistling flick through midwicket to finish the over. Even better contact than his opening boundary. You can't stray near this chap's pads!
punched down to mid-on
beautiful bowling... now you see it, now you don't. Outside off, hitting the seam, lay a bat on that if you can!
fuller and floatier. Drilled into the covers with lots of bottom hand for emphasis
punched back to the bowler, well timed again but too straight to beat the man in his followthrough
tight line once again
on the hands, flicked square

on the pads, worked fine and blimey, that would have been out by a mile if Parnell's shy had smashed the stumps at the non-striker's end. Tahir could have done a bit more to get behind the stumps too...
well bowled, tight line on off stump and kicking on after pitching. Defended on the back foot
outside off, worked into the covers
thumped into the covers once again
reverse sweep, into position early but doesn't quite nail it
the googly to finish Bailey climbs into a pull and scuffs it behind square
dobbled onto a good length, a distinct lack of pace
tight line, eased off the hip to midwicket
wider on the crease, as a Chris-Harris-esque leg-roller floats onto a good length and is pushed to cover
an ambitious wipe, aiming to clear mid-off, but no connection this time
tight line, offering nothing to get one's teeth into. Defended back to the bowler with a frustrated push

a big mow, a spiralling top-edge, who wants this ... no, in fact, it's cleared everyone and caught the breeze in the thin Highveld air, and plopped over the rope at third man! A bit of a let-off. Not the most convincing six of his career
pushed back down the pitch
another googly, turns sharply and defended to the leg side
loopy full toss, on the pads, and flicked hard out to deep midwicket
outside off, hangs back in the crease, and worked down to third man
onto the front foot, worked around the pad to midwicket
now that's a better six! A big stride, a free flow of the bat, and an effortless deposit over the bowler's head. Plops onto the concourse, five metres beyond the rope
eased down the ground
a sharp single to short midwicket, and Head was on his heels and had the throw been any closer to the keeper, he would surely have been a goner! Lucky...
tapped down to long-on
tight line on off stump, Bailey attempts to work into the leg-side but the bowler fields in his followthrough
worked through third man with soft hands, and that's a pretty feeble dive at backward point. All the way to the rope and Bailey marches on
outside off, poked to third man again but fielded this time
stabbed into the off side, and a quick single
looped onto a good length outside off, pushed circumspectly to long-off for the single
clipped off the pads but straight to midwicket
good areas ...

that is tremendous wrist-spin bowling. Beautiful flight, luring Head out of the crease, dipping late, and lo and behold, it's the googly to boot. Zips past a flailing edge like a winger side-stepping the fullback, and off come the bails!

cripes, that was close! Down on one knee for the sweep, and that plants a smacker on the new batsman's chest! If it had turned, he could easily have been bowled round his legs as he was nowhere near that
inside edge, and those are unlucky runs to concede. No-one there ...
outside off and a sweetly timed crunch to deep point where Duminy does well to cut off the boundary
onto the front foot, driven on the up to cover
a genuine edge, and a simple catch for second slip in a Test match... but this is a one-dayer, so it's a well-placed four through third man. Sucks to be a bowler these days...
a crashing cut, as Steyn loses his line in a slightly furious upping of the pace, and that is slam-basted through third man. A costly return so far ...
driven on the up, off the back foot, to short cover
tossed onto a good length, and defended to the off side
worked into the leg side, from a tight line once again
outside off, and punched sweetly off the back foot through the covers. Well placed
on the back foot and defended
on the pads, and worked behind square
pushed back onto the stumps and defended
tight line and defended into the leg side
on the back foot, pushed into the covers where an excellent grab limits the damage
on the pads, clipped to midwicket and David Miller, on the dive, smashes the stumps at the non-striker's end with Wade nowhere close to the picture! Outstanding sharp work and a vital breakthrough
good wheels, whizzing through from back of a length
angled defence into the off side
low full-toss, clipped out to deep midwicket
googly, misdirected and a touch too short as well. Hastings has all the time in the world to rock onto the back foot, swivel through the line and clobber it over the rope!
lots of air outside off, dipping late and clubbed back towards the non-striker, where Tahir tidies up
on the pads, worked to the leg side
onto the front foot, and driven to cover
on the back foot, pushed into the leg side
defended back down the track, tight line
driven with intent, straight back to the bowler
on the back foot, opens the face to angle the ball down to third man
on the back foot, worked into the leg side and that's a maiden. Well bowled Lucky, he's been outstanding today after a slightly ropey start
on the front foot, pumped up the pitch to mid-off
down on one knee and swung through backward square
tight bowling once again as short midwicket gathers
standing tall on the back foot, and pushed out to cover
eased down the ground to long-on
worked out to the covers off the back foot. and that will be drinks
back of a length and defended coming across on off
similar line and Hastings taps it down into the off side again
slashed over slip, Miller leaps but can't get there! Bit of a wiffy waft but Hastings gets away with it
good length on off and pushed away this time
slips in the attempted yorker, thudding into the pads but heading slightly leg side
fullish, worked off the pads into the lg side for a single
flighted, maybe the googly, Hastings prods towards midwicket
tossed up on odd stump and defended into the covers

big lbw shout from Tahir, Hastings back in his crease, umpire Bongani Jele shakes the head... but SA like it and roll out the review. Could this be the moment the new DRS rules kick in for the bowler? No, because Hawk-Eye says it was missing leg stump! Not straightening quite enough, no bonus for Tahir
floated up on the stumps and worked through the leg side for one
pushed through on the stumps and Bailey nurdles one more to deep midwicket
flighted, outside off, Hastings steers it down behind square
banged in short, Bailey rocks back and swats a cut down to third man for one
beats the outside edge, good pace as Hastings was hanging back in the crease
the big man comes across on off stump and blocks
angled in with the arm, 135kph and nudged into a gap on the leg side
length ball, over the top of middle and off, Bailey blocks into the covers
touch short, 131kph and flicked away, maybe off the thigh pad, for one to square leg
presses forward to block on off stump
pushed through outside off, too much width and Hastings brings those big bear-like forearms down through a crushing cut behind square
googly, on the stumps and pulled through midwicket
tossed up and Bailey can't get it away through the leg side
floated up full outside the line of off and punched firmly to mid-off
Tahir gives this some air, straightening on off stump, Bailey gets a stride in to defend
bowling round the wicket, slightly back of a length outside off, pushed in front of square
kicks a bit more off a length, 143kph and steered towards point
dug in short outside off and ramped, nicely played and it soars fine of third man, bounces to the rope!
slightly short and worked off the body through backward square for one
bangs the ball in, Bailey rolls the wrists on a pull through square
well-directed short ball, rising towards the solar plexus, Hastings gets into line and defends
floated up on the stumps, goes down to sweep one behind square
tossed up and defended coming forwards on off
flighted, Hastings goes down on one knee and aims a wild yahoo to leg, gets it away off inside edge
prods forward in defence
Tahir drops a little short and Bailey is swiftly across to swish the ball flat through backward square leg, finds the gap
happy to push the last ball away - only one more over of Tahir left
back of a length, on the stumps, Hastings defends from the ramparts
shot from the big man! Makes a bit of room and laces a drive between extra cover and mid-off, that'll run away
boy, that's travelled! Thin air up here... Not an overly bad ball, bit of width and Hastings gets down on one knee to Maxwell it all the way over backward point, just a flat slice but it flew
shortish, tighter to the stumps, blocked
Parnell slings down the bouncer, slightly leg side but gets away with it
short and straight, draws himself up to defend in front the stumps
slower ball to begin with, Bailey comes across to defend on off
pitched up, 137kph on middle and off, driven without timing towards mid-on
taking the pace off again, Bailey can't do much with it into the covers
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and clips with the angle though midwicket
in the channel outside off, 139kph and Hastings pushes tentatively, gets a thick outside edge to third man
touch short, Bailey hops back and steers behind the diving backward point for one more
Parnell goes short and Bailey walks across to glance another single fine
length on the stumps, nudged to the left of mid-on, who hurtles across to grab the ball
tight single this...! Hastings gets a leading edge behind square, playing across the line but Bailey wants one and has to hurry as Rossouw hurls the throw in but misses
maybe a slower ball, deceives Bailey, whose flick to leg pops into the off side
shorter length, 142kph and worked away through square leg for one
banged in very short and veering down the leg side as Hastings sort of curtsies at it
short outside off this time, gets up sharply and hits the bottom edge as Hastings tries to dab off the back foot
Steyn pus it on a length outside off, steered towards point
pitched up, gets on to the front foot, drives to cover
drags his length down, Bailey swivel-pulls through square - brings up the Australia 250
Hastings backs away, slaps over point, in the air off the toe of the bat but it skips behind the man sweeping on the boundary and goes for four... Steyn not happy
Steyn throws himself across the pitch to try and cut off one to long-on... in vain
pitched up and flicked off the toes, through wide mid-on and Steyn hares after it again, keeps them to a single
pitched up and clipped back down the ground for one more
banged in and climbing through to the keeper, beating the top edge
boshed, another short ball but met with a sweet pull, hook-line-and-sinkered through midwicket
pitched up outside off, drilled with malice aforethought but straight to mid-off, who's set back on the edge of the ring
on the stumps, wicket-to-wicket from Lucky, turned to the leg side
comes across on off stump and dabs behind square
starts with a wide long-hop that Bailey does well to get the toe of the bat on
floated up on off stump, driven through mid-off to the man coming in off the fence
bit more air, dipping and spinning to hit the splice as Bailey reaches for it
another slow legbreak, pushed to the man at cover coming forwards
quicker, maybe the googly, Bailey swats it into the covers but again can't get it through

flighted legbreak to finish, draws the edge but he gets enough on it to send the ball wide of de Kock! They get two and Tahir trudges off with his jumper over his face. He is an emotional sphinx, that guy
pitched up on middle stump, Hastings calmly flicks another single through midwicket - he's on to 49
banged in, way too short and down the leg side
goes full and straight, 144kph but neatly taken through the leg side
Hastings backs away, banged in and following him, defended
on the stumps, manages to squeeze one into a gap in the covers - raise of the bat for the Hastings fifty, his first in an Australia shirt. Been a doughty knock from the Duke
short ball, hooked around the corner, just one to deep square
pitched up and bullocked straight back, in the air and deflected by Rabada's outstretched arm... that way well have removed Joel Wilson's cap if the bowler hadn't got something on it!

got him, launched down the ground but straight to long-off, picked him out perfectly! He's got the touch today, Phehlukwayo strikes first ball - bowled for and got, I'm sure. Hastings' defiant rearguard some to an end
goes for the back-of-the-hand slower ball but loses his line outside off
fired in, just inside the tramlines, Bailey can't chop down on it
another slowie, hits the splice of the bat, Bailey nudges one to leg
fullish, Zampa presses forward and pushed back
is that the five-for? Phehlukwayo appeals for an inside edge as Zampa swings across the line... looks like it flicked the shirt on its way through
a wide full toss to finish with, swatted through backward point for one
shortish and at the body, worked short into the leg side
good bouncer, Zampa flails unsuccessfully across the line
back of a length, Zampa steps away... and creams a back-foot drive through the covers, lovely stroke
pitched up and following the batsman to leg, squeezed out

appeal for lbw, followed by a missed run out at each end! All that for nothing... Rabada speared the ball into the blockhole, think Zampa bottom-edged it on to his boot, set off for the run, de Kock missed with an underarm and then Rabada chose not to throw at the non-striker's end with Bailey struggling to regain his ground!
banged in short and searing through above the attempted pull to finish the over

the slower ball does him! Bailey gets right underneath it and slogs to mid-on, all height and no trousers, Australia's linchpin falls! Still almost three overs to go but Bailey had to try and get on with it if they are to breach 300
pitched full on off stump, gets forward but punches back to the bowler
back of a length, bit of width and sliced away over backward point for a couple
another slower ball, cleverly disguised, Zampa swings and misses

slugged over the off-side ring, a mishit drive but Phehlukwayo has his work cut out to get there... skims the fingertips but he can't hold on! Would have been a brilliant take coming down over his shoulder
fires in the yorker, slightly too full and Steyn then belts out an impassioned, almost-operatic appeal... Replays show it hit the middle of the bat. Oh
pitched up on off and punched down the ground
tight line, Worrall plays it late and adroitly behind point to pick up a single
dug in, 146kph and aimed at the earhole, Zampa is off his feet! He wasn't far off windmilling a pull away but that was lightning quick and he ended up diving for cover
another back-of-a-length ball, hits Zampa on the body and Rabada chases after it
slips in the yorker, just off target, under the bat but past leg stump!
full-bunger to finish, Zampa makes room and clubs one through mid-off - decent over from the Gazelle of Doom, kept his figures just about respectable

scooped straight up and taken at mid-on! Second wicket for Dale Steyn, a carbon copy of Bailey's dismissal, the cutter too cute for Zampa and it's catching practice for Miller on the edge of the circle
squeezed out through the leg side
banged in short outside off, Boland swings and misses
full and straight, clipped off the pads, this could be four... but Parnell does a good job on the fine-leg boundary
full outside off, Boland tries to lever a drive over mid-off, bounces short and Miller does well to stop it on the dive

full toss, whipped with fast hands, a crisp blow from Worrall to finish the innings with a four through square leg, Rabada's full-length dive unsuccessful - so, that means South Africa will need 295 to win

inn2.comm: tight line, defended into the covers
back onto the stumps, worked into the leg side
on the pads, nurdled fine, and they jog through for the single
onto the front foot, and pumped into the covers
eased round the corner to backward square leg
worked behind square once more, a nice tight over from the nearly new boy
sliding down the leg side
a heavy ball outside off, kicking off the turf and defended a touch uneasily on the back foot
on the legs and lambasted into the crowd! Stunning power and timing, just a fraction off-line and clobbered over square leg!
outside off this time, and though Finch got a hand on it, that was sizzling as it came off the bat. A full-blooded flog through point
round the wicket, and a tighter line into the left-hander this time
on the pads, worked square
on the back foot, drilled on the up into the covers. A better finish to the over, but South Africa are up and running
on the pads, and whisked away, past the diving man at forward square leg. You can't bowl there to Quinton de Kock
better line, outside off and angling away. de Kock hangs back in the crease and plays later
width again, probably too wide, but de Kock snatched at the shot and didn't quite time it
that's what he meant to do! Planted the front foot and eased his bat through the line. Pure timing and placement through the covers
back of a length and climbing into the hip. De Kock leans back and blocks into the leg side

down the leg side, and smashed high and hard down to backward square leg where Hastings makes good ground but cant' quite get his hands under the ball. He does well to bail out of the catch and opt instead to save the boundary
smashed to the man at point. Quinton is seeing it nicely this evening ...
outside off, worked to leg with a roll of the wrists
smashed through the covers once more. Beautiful base and a strong fling of the hands. Quality
back of a length and defended from the crease
battered on the up through point, but a good sprawling save to cut off the boundary
tightens up on off stump, defended back down the pitch
in the channel from Worrall
outside off, driven on the up, and a fat outside edge squirts safely down to third man
defended to the off side
round the wicket, and that's beautifully worked with the angle into the leg side. A bit of a chase at deep midwicket to intercept
tight line, angling into off stump, defended to cover
forward, and tapped into the gap in the covers. Lovely timing, and cut off with a slide on the boundary's edge
rolling into a fierce pull, but Zampa at midwicket fields well
extra pace and  bounce and that got up from nowhere! A teasing leading edge loops into no-man's land, but safe!
that's a decent riposte! Banged in and battered through square leg. A roundhouse pull
forward and defended
outside off, and riding the bounce with a slightly peculiar back-cut through third man
on the pads again and that's just easy pickings. So strong with his timing through the leg side. A futile chase and dive from Travis Head as the ball gallops to the rope
thumped through point once again. A roll of the wrists, oodles of width to play with, and if that ball had pants, they would have been timed off by now
well worked into the gap to rotate the strike
eased into the leg side from a tighter line

a violent swish across the line, and given the altitude that we are already at, that could be the highest a cricket ball has ever gone in an international fixture! A desperate chase from the cordon, led by Wade, but the ball just eludes them as it plugs inside the rope
back and across to defend
outside off, cut fiercely and half-stopped at gully. But they scamper the single nonetheless
tighter line, nothing doing there
clipped into the leg side
too full, too wide, too easy to lean back and spank it through point! Australia haven't hit their straps just yet ...
angled defence into the covers. But what defence! The timing is exquisite, the placement is impeccable, just in front of square, and Australia can't cut that off!
poked out to cover once more
up on the toes, driving hard into the off side but short cover is on hand this time
well ... that's just a revolting half-tracker, and it is murderously deposited through long-off with a flat bat and heavyweight power! Have some of that!
much wider, chasing the leather, and toe-ended out to point
defended back down the pitch, much better line and length, threatening the off stump
smashed hard into the covers once more, but straight to the fielder this time
eased into the gap in the covers once again. Such timing and placement on display
easy, easy! Superb timing and placement again, this time straight down the ground. Head over the ball, bat coming through the line. No violence required
up on the toes and pumped out to cover again
too much width and South Africa are rampant! Clubbed on the up, through the covers, with utter disdain!
down the track now, Roussouw is in the mood! A roundhouse swipe through the leg-side, to hell with finesse, just wallop it son!
hanging back in the crease this time, and bludgeoned to square leg. Lots of power but straight to the fielder for a change
defended with intent, on the up to mid-off
banged in short, and he was waiting for that one. Anchored on the back foot, and wiping his bat across his face. The timing comes as standard. He's seeing it like a comet now
worked into the covers, on the front foot
solidly forward, punched to the man at short cover. He's rather in the firing line ...
hanging back and attempting to work a single to leg. Doesn't quite time it for a change
sharp work in the covers to cut off another fierce drive
ooh, streaky! Another charge down the track, a fat outside edge, but the catch doesn't carry to deep backward point, who is nutmegged by the spin for good measure
onto the front foot, pushed to cover, and that is a relative win for Australia. Just three runs from the over
too short, another slamming pull through the leg side, and that is de Kock's fifty!
better line and length, de Kock hangs back to defend into the off side
worked into the leg side again
tight line, worked to the leg side
Rossouw returns the compliment
swiped violently, and despite another desperate dive, that's yet another four through square leg. Fetched from outside off, but timed with such power
tapped into the gap, South Africa can afford to milk it a bit now ...
onto the front foot, pushed into the covers
outside off, crashed into the covers again, but short cover is once again in business to intercept
tight line again, worked to leg with a roll of the wrists
flogged through the off side once more. The sweeper rushes round to save the four, but that's wonderfully timed once again
forward and defended
round the wicket, defended on the back foot into the leg side
in the air, and that's another stroke of good fortune for South Africa! Banged in short, another ambitious pull takes the splice, but Hastings in the covers can't cling on with one hand!
crikey, it's all happening now, as Marsh on the backward square leg rope backpedals in a bid to intercept a violent pull, but can't cling on!
back on the stumps to defend, sharp delivery. The Aussies are riled now!
worked into the deep for another single
on the pads, nurdled square
on the back foot, punched out to the deep
back of a length, and keeps a touch low too. Rossouw pulls with caution, and runs through for a hugely well-deserved fifty from 36 balls. Tremendous
wicket to wicket. Defended back to the bowler

good grief, that's huge! Marsh misses his length, so de Kock shows him the error of his ways with a brutal wipe across the line. Right under the ball and battered over square leg. He's broken his bat with that shot, and looks a bit gutted about it!
outside off, dabbed through third man
crashed down the ground to mid-off, and timed so well that he almost holed out. Fortunately for the batsman, the ball died just short
on the pads, worked square
banged in short. Good sharp delivery
back of a length again, pushed to cover
round the wicket and this is a tight line, Defended again
misses his length this time, and the round-the-wicket line means that Rossouw can just lean back and chop yet another four through backward point
shorter, pulled with intent but no timing for a change. Nothing is going to hand for the Aussie fielders though ... they need a break, and soon.
on the pads, tapped square
whoomph! A roundhouse swing of the blade, like mugging a pensioner with a sock of sand. Over long-on and onto the bank!
outside off, crunched through point
heaved over midwicket once again! This is just cherry-picking from South Africa. Two sixes in the over and Australia have no recourse
eased down to mid-off
that might be my favourite shot of the night. Arrow-straight drive, weight coming through the ball from a beautifully structured base. And that is 18 off the over

that's a bingo, strikes first ball! Tosses up the legbreak from over the wicket, Rossouw attempts a reverse sweep and is hit on the front pad, the ball spinning back in - looked pretty adjacent to off stump. Job's a good'un for the moustachoied young spinner
tossed up and prodded away square on the back foot
drags this down, du Plessis swivels to play a forehand smash through midwicket, a misfield on the rope gives them four
pushed through, comes across this time and steers a single through the covers
slightly short again, de Kocks smashes a pull through the leg side, Warner won't get there on the slide but deep square is covering behind him
flatter, maybe the googly, Quinny drops back and slices one more through backward point

pitched up and cracked back down the pitch, straight into umpire Joel Wilson! He's okay, struck on the back of the arm, I think, as he made like a turtle and tucked everything in. Would have been four all day, but for the red-shirted official in the way
angled across, slightly short of a length and sliced to third man
back of a length and skidding on, steered towards point from the crease
comes across and defends into the off side
shortish, makes a bit of room and pierces the ring with a drive on the up
angled across on off stump, 133kph and de Kock shows it the maker's name
floated up around off, Faf nudges it into the off side
comes forward and pushes a single through mid-off
floated up and clipped back down the ground, using the feet
tossed up and prodded into the covers coming forwards
beautifully bowled, Zampa gets some dip and turn, past the outside edge as du Plessis flails at it
tossed up even slower, gripping outside off and defended on the back foot
that's not going to exercise Quinny too much, a low full toss and he flumps it casually back over mid-on and away
pushed across the lefty's bow, happy to skim one more to third man
du Plessis walks across and prods defensively square
length ball outside off, this is steered through cover point to the sweeper
slower ball from Worrall, de Kock sits back and mistimes a pull to mid-on
pitched up and driven firmly but Worrall throws himself to his right in his follow through and grasps the ball
floated up around off, stabbed into the covers
pushed through, du Plessis comes forward and steers a single to long-off
tossed up from over the wicket, de Kock defends
rolled out on off stump, makes room and tries to flog through the covers, not a clean strike
slower, loopy legbreak on the pads, can't work it past the square fielder
pushed through outside off this time and de Kock squirrels one through point to the sweeper
shortish and offering some width, slides it off the face past backward point, who gets a hand on it to keep them to a couple
oh, that's a magnificent way to go to a hundred! Slightly short and pulled with regal disdain over deep midwicket, whistling out of the middle and bringing the crowd to their feet again
better length, on the stumps, tapped away
dug in short, maybe a slower ball, but it loops through too high for the umpires' liking
brings up his monster scoop and sends Worrall over deep fine leg this time! He's peppering the stands and the crowd are loving it!
slower ball from Worrall, comes forward to punch down the ground
good length on off, du Plessis taps it calmly away
now he goes after Zampa, slightly short and he hoicks over square leg, bounces away
comes forward and pushes back down the ground
flighted, on the legs, can't get the sweep away
serves up a full toss, this is swung away merrily through backward square leg for another boundary. Quinny is stomping all over this chase
angled across, slightly short this time, a rapier cut through backward point fizzes to the fence once more
floated up on the legs, de Kock shows some mercy and nudges it away
length ball, du Plessis sits back and steers behind point
better lengths from Hastings, de Kock can only work to midwicket
pitched up and clipped down the ground
du Plessis moves across on off stump and pushes through the covers
fullish, outside off, de Kock threads another in front of square
pitched up in the channel, de Plessis crunches one more out to deep cover
round the wicket, tossed up and prodded through point
gives it some air, lollipop on off stump, de Kock pushes down the ground, brings up the SA 200
very leg side, swatted away for another single
de Kock again uses the feet and places one more to long-on
flat, non-turning offbreak on the stumps, tickled fine
tossed up a little leg side and de Kock nudges away square to finish an over of singles
speared across, bit of extra bounce, past the outside edge and into the gloves, Wade forlornly tossing the ball in the air
pitched up outside off, steps out and squires one down the ground
shortish, outside off and blocked coming across
dug in, 126kph and hitting the splice, du Plessis drops a single in front of point
fullish in the channel and shovelled through the covers
bouncer, banged in, too short
extra bounce here, du Plessis takes a blow on the thumb but it rolls away behind point and they trot a single
angled in and played on the back foot wide of point
Marsh gets the ball to lift off a length this time, past the outside edge of de Kock's punisher
slightly short, goes for the pull and gets a bit of a bottom edge, well taken at midwicket after a dodgy bounce
short again and this is fetched over midwicket, another clean kill on the pull for Quinny
only a touch full but de Kock manufactures a slog, doesn't quite hit through the line but it screws away off the inside half of the bat and runs through midwicket
swung into the stands once again, de Kock's sixth six! Beastly, another clean-as-a-whistle hit into the crowd to bring up his highest score in ODIs
du Plessis steps out and pushes a single through the covers... he's just pottering around
shortish, tries to pull and gets a bit tucked up
there she blows, another short ball swallowed up by the night sky and spat out into the crowd! De Kock's turning into a six addict
slower ball in response from Hastings, steered through the off side coming forwards
pitched up outside off, drilled through the covers in front of the sweeper and they get back for two
flat outside off and de Kock leans back and heaves it over wide long-off, lands it on the rope - that's six more, and the 150 up in the process!
this is getting indecent! Plonks Zampa even further back over the same part of the ground, leaning back like a drunken brawler to shovel it beyond the ropes
6-6-6, Beast Mode enabled! Tossed up in the arc and de Kock slgo-sweeps beyond the ropes with insouciant ease
goes for the big leg-side heave again, hit flat and hard but cut off on the boundary
tossed up and du Plessis defends. That's the spirit
flighted, comes on to the front foot, pushes through the covers to keep the strike - boo!
pitched up and stroked through the covers
shortish, pulled over deep midwicket - that's hit a cameraman! De Kock is a health hazard here tonight and Australia have almost given up searching for a remedy. That's his eleventh six
goes round the wicket, full and slow... and outside the tramlines
back of a length outside off, steered square, no violence in this stroke
full toss wide of the stumps, leathered through the covers but there's a man to cut it off
good length outside off, Faf clips one more into the deep
swings another single off his hips through midwicket - Kirsten is getting obliterated, the only question is whether Faf lets him get to 200
length ball, on the pads, de Kock swings malevolently to leg but gets just one to the boundary rider
dug in, jumps across and pokes the ball away on the back foot
pitched up outside off and driven to the sweeper, they come back for two
bowled him, Faf plays on! Boland doesn't bother to celebrate, decent ball that maybe nibbled back in a touch, slightly loose poke from the captain and the zing bails light up
angled across on off stump, JP gets into line
138kph and rising off a good length, Duminy comes forward and shows it a straight bat. Over to you, Quinny...
sprays the ball full and wide, de Kock has to reach for it but windscreen wipers a couple in front of deep cover. That takes him past Gibbs' score in the 438 game
touch short, swatted through the covers for one more
flashes at this one and misses. Steady on
pitched up and drilled through the covers, that'll run all the way. Duminy hasn't read the script
Marsh lands the ball full in the channel, driven to mid-off
touch back of a length, 130 kays and nudged through backward square for one more to pinch the strike
Duminy isn't standing on ceremony for his team-mate, steps forward and launches Boland inside out over cover, that will bounce away, too... The maths are no longer in de Kock's favour

hooks the bumper, excellent take at deep square leg! So Duminy crashes the party and then ends up falling the pool... Another wicket for Boland, courtesy a low grab diving in from the boundary by Head
short ball, pushed across and de Kock skips out, swings violently... but misses

dug in again, de Kock hooks hard - but this time it's his undoing! Head takes another superbly judged catch running along the rope and de Kock has to walk off 11 short of a national record... Centurion stands for the centurion, he gets some handshakes on his way off. A quite brilliant innings that has made a difficult chase look simple
good length outside off, Behardien prods it safely down into the off side
pitched up a bit further and Behardien gets going with a drive through the covers
Behardien comes forward and pushes a full ball into the off side
length outside off, drops back and runs a single to third man
on the stumps, Miller flips a couple through midwicket off his pads
touch fuller, 130kph on off, pushes along the carpet to mid-off
shortish, nudged off the pads in front of square... Getting closer
bumper to finish the over, Behardien ducks it. Perhaps he wants to savour this one
drops short, slightly wide and Miller swats at it, gets a top edge over the slips and cuts the requirement in half
on the body, worked away for a single
slightly back of a length, Behardien waits in the crease and tucks it to leg
pitched up, creeps forward and drives to mid-off. Ho hum
full and wide and Miller throws the hands, mistimes it into the covers
good length outside off, opens the face for one to third man... and the scores are level. Hurrah!
length ball in the channel, Miller drops it towards backward point... no run there!
tucked off the hips, past midwicket... that's the badger, South Africa win by six wickets
